intro: Ceropegia geniculata, commonly known as the zigzag fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in sandy soils. Ceropegia geniculata is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions.
